DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Creatinine Clearance Assessment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to assessment of a sample of blood for creatinine clearance, the amount of creatinine eliminated from the blood stream by the kidneys measured by laboratory test.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to assessment of a sample of blood for creatinine clearance, the amount of creatinine eliminated from the blood stream by the kidneys measured by laboratory test.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

DataElementConcept.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance >60 mL/min/1.73m² for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance >=60 mL/min/1.73m² by the Cockcroft-Gault equation

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance >60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance >=60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 by the Cockcroft-Gault equation

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance >=60 ml/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measured or calculated creatinine clearance >= 60 mL/min for patient with creatinine levels > 1.5 x ULN

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance >60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Creatinine clearance >60 mL/min or >60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the Calculated Creatinine Clearance obtained within 2 weeks of registration and calculated CrCl was greater than or equal to 45mL/min using the standard Cockcroft and Gault formula (See Appendix), or the measured glomerular filtration rate (GFR) using the appropriate radiolabeled method (51-CrEDTA or Tc99m-DTPA) was used to calculate CrCl?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does participant have Calculated/estimated or measured creatinine clearance at least 50 ml/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min using the Cockroft-Gault formula within 28 days before randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min using the Cockroft-Gault formula within 28 days before study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min using the Cockroft-Gault formula within 28 days before Step 1/Study entry?

DataElement.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-2 2018320v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
